elements.title: circumstances
elements.text: circumstances requiring users to log out of the system are defined.

elements.title: time period
elements.text: the time period of expected inactivity requiring users to log out of the system is defined.

elements.title: time period
elements.text: the time period within which to notify account managers and designated personnel or roles when system usage or the need-to-know changes for an individual is defined.

elements.title: time period
elements.text: the time period within which to notify account managers and designated personnel or roles when users are terminated or transferred is defined.

elements.title: time period
elements.text: the time period within which to notify account managers and designated personnel or roles when accounts are no longer required is defined.

elements.title: frequency
elements.text: the frequency at which to review the privileges assigned to roles or classes of users is defined.

elements.title: security-relevant information
elements.text: security-relevant information for authorized access is defined.

elements.title: security functions
elements.text: security functions for authorized access are defined.

elements.title: personnel or roles
elements.text: personnel or roles to which privileged accounts on the system are to be restricted are defined.

elements.title: SELECTED PARAMETER VALUES
elements.text: one or more of the following PARAMETER VALUES are selected: {the account or node is locked automatically for <A.03.01.08.ODP[04]: time period>; the account or node is locked automatically until released by an administrator; the next logon prompt is delayed automatically; the system administrator is notified automatically; other action is taken automatically}.
the time period for an account or node to be locked is defined (if selected).

elements.title: number
elements.text: the number of consecutive invalid logon attempts by a user allowed during a time period is defined.

elements.title: time period
elements.text: the time period to which the number of consecutive invalid logon attempts by a user is limited is defined.

elements.title: SELECTED PARAMETER VALUES
elements.text: one or more of the following PARAMETER VALUES are selected: {a device lock is initiated after <A.03.01.10.ODP[02]: time period> of inactivity; the user is required to initiate a device lock before leaving the system unattended}.
the time period of inactivity after which a device lock is initiated is defined (if selected).

elements.title: conditions or trigger events
elements.text: conditions or trigger events that require session disconnect are defined.

elements.title: security requirements
elements.text: security requirements to be satisfied on external systems prior to allowing the use of or access to those systems by authorized individuals are defined.

elements.title: conditions
elements.text: conditions that require the rescreening of individuals are defined.

elements.title: time period
elements.text: the time period within which to disable system access is defined.

elements.title: security requirements
elements.text: security requirements to protect against supply chain risks to the system, system components, or system services and to limit the harm or consequences from supply chain-related events are defined.

elements.title: frequency
elements.text: the frequency at which to review and update the supply chain risk management plan is defined.

elements.title: frequency
elements.text: the frequency at which the system security plan is reviewed and updated is defined.

elements.title: frequency
elements.text: the frequency at which the rules of behavior are reviewed and updated is defined.

elements.title: time period
elements.text: the time period for account inactivity before disabling is defined.

elements.title: frequency
elements.text: the frequency at which the policies and procedures for satisfying security requirements are reviewed and updated is defined.

elements.title: security requirements
elements.text: security requirements to be satisfied by external system service providers are defined.

elements.title: configurations
elements.text: configurations for systems or system components to be issued to individuals traveling to high-risk locations are defined.

elements.title: systems security engineering principles
elements.text: systems security engineering principles to be applied to the development or modification of the system and system components are defined.

elements.title: security requirements
elements.text: security requirements to be applied to the system or system components when individuals return from travel are defined.

elements.title: ports
elements.text: ports to be prohibited or restricted are defined.

elements.title: functions
elements.text: functions to be prohibited or restricted are defined.

elements.title: frequency
elements.text: the frequency at which to review the system to identify unnecessary or nonsecure functions, ports, protocols, connections, or services is defined.

elements.title: services
elements.text: services to be prohibited or restricted are defined.

elements.title: connections
elements.text: connections to be prohibited or restricted are defined.

elements.title: protocols
elements.text: protocols to be prohibited or restricted are defined.

elements.title: frequency
elements.text: the frequency at which to review and update the list of authorized software programs is defined.

elements.title: frequency
elements.text: the frequency at which to review and update the system component inventory is defined.

elements.title: configuration settings
elements.text: configuration settings for the system that reflect the most restrictive mode consistent with operational requirements are defined.

elements.title: frequency
elements.text: the frequency of baseline configuration review and update is defined.

elements.title: time period
elements.text: the time period of inactivity after which the system terminates a network connection associated with a communications session is defined.

elements.title: requirements
elements.text: requirements for key generation, distribution, storage, access, and destruction are defined.

elements.title: types of cryptography
elements.text: the types of cryptography for protecting the confidentiality of CUI are defined.

elements.title: exceptions
elements.text: exceptions where remote activation is to be allowed are defined.

elements.title: time period
elements.text: the time period within which incident response training is to be provided to system users is defined.

elements.title: frequency
elements.text: the frequency at which to provide incident response training to users after initial training is defined.

elements.title: frequency
elements.text: the frequency at which to review and update incident response training content is defined.

elements.title: events
elements.text: events that initiate a review of the incident response training content are defined.

elements.title: frequency
elements.text: the frequency at which to test the effectiveness of the incident response capability for the system is defined.

elements.title: authorities
elements.text: authorities to whom incident information is to be reported are defined.

elements.title: time period
elements.text: the time period to report suspected incidents to the organizational incident response capability is defined.

elements.title: frequency
elements.text: the frequency at which to review and update agreements is defined.

elements.title: SELECTED PARAMETER VALUES
elements.text: one or more of the following PARAMETER VALUES are selected: {interconnection security agreements; information exchange security agreements; memoranda of understanding or agreement; service-level agreements; user agreements; non-disclosure agreements; other types of agreements}.

elements.title: frequency
elements.text: the frequency at which to assess the security requirements for the system and its environment of operation is defined.

elements.title: frequency
elements.text: the frequency at which to review physical access logs is defined.

elements.title: events or potential indicators of events
elements.text: events or potential indications of events requiring physical access logs to be reviewed are defined.

elements.title: security requirements
elements.text: security requirements to be employed at alternate work sites are defined.

elements.title: frequency
elements.text: the frequency at which system audit records are reviewed and analyzed is defined.

elements.title: frequency
elements.text: the frequency at which to review the access list detailing authorized facility access by individuals is defined.

elements.title: granularity of time measurement
elements.text: granularity of time measurement for audit record time stamps is defined.

elements.title: time period
elements.text: the time period for preventing the reuse of identifiers is defined.

elements.title: frequency
elements.text: the frequency at which to update the list of commonly used, expected, or compromised passwords is defined.

elements.title: characteristic
elements.text: characteristic used to identify individual status are defined.

elements.title: rules
elements.text: password composition and complexity rules are defined.

elements.title: time period
elements.text: the time period for organizational personnel or roles receiving audit logging process failure alerts is defined.

elements.title: additional actions
elements.text: additional actions to be taken in the event of an audit logging process failure are defined.

elements.title: frequency
elements.text: the frequency of event types selected for logging are reviewed and updated.

elements.title: events
elements.text: events that trigger the change or refreshment of authenticators are defined.

elements.title: frequency
elements.text: the frequency for changing or refreshing authenticators is defined.

elements.title: event types
elements.text: event types selected for logging within the system are defined.

elements.title: types of system media
elements.text: types of system media with usage restrictions or that are prohibited from use are defined.

elements.title: devices or types of devices
elements.text: devices or types of devices to be uniquely identified and authenticated before establishing a connection are defined.

elements.title: circumstances or situations
elements.text: circumstances or situations that require re-authentication are defined.

elements.title: events
elements.text: events that require security literacy training content updates are defined.

elements.title: frequency
elements.text: the frequency at which to update security literacy training content is defined.

elements.title: events
elements.text: events that require role-based security training content updates are defined.

elements.title: frequency
elements.text: the frequency at which to update role-based security training content is defined.

elements.title: events
elements.text: events that require role-based security training are defined.

elements.title: frequency
elements.text: the frequency at which to provide role-based security training to assigned personnel after initial training is defined.

elements.title: frequency
elements.text: the frequency at which to update system vulnerabilities to be scanned is defined.

elements.title: events
elements.text: events that require security literacy training for system users are defined.

elements.title: frequency
elements.text: the frequency at which to provide security literacy training to system users after initial training is defined.

elements.title: frequency
elements.text: the frequency at which to update the risk assessment is defined.

elements.title: response times
elements.text: response times to remediate system vulnerabilities are defined.

elements.title: frequency
elements.text: the frequency at which the system is scanned for vulnerabilities is defined.

elements.title: frequency
elements.text: the frequency at which the system is monitored for vulnerabilities is defined.

elements.title: time period
elements.text: the time period within which to install security-relevant firmware updates after the release of the updates is defined.

elements.title: frequency
elements.text: the frequency at which malicious code protection mechanisms perform scans is defined.

elements.title: time period
elements.text: the time period within which to install security-relevant software updates after the release of the updates is defined.
